tracks.title: Ghosts Of Us
tracks.lyrics:
In a dim-lit room where shadows weave,
Whispers linger, hearts deceive,
We’re stuck in time, can’t find reprieve,
Living the same lie, we can't believe.
Every touch, a memory fades,
Haunted by the games we played,
Round and round, our love turns to dust,
We're just the ghosts, the ghosts of us.

And I fell in love with an idea
And then it was real
The blossoming the bloom
The baby in the womb
And the idea of this
This is what I miss
Is the idea of this

Neon signs flicker, casting gloom,
Secrets hidden in this tomb,
Every kiss, a flower’s bloom,
Wilting in the endless room.
Every lie, a silent scream,
Every truth, a shattered dream,
In this loop, we’re lost, it seems,
Time’s a thief that plots and schemes

Before it was real
Long before the steal
When it was just an idea
A shimmer of pearl
And a midnight game
A mighty open road with an open gate
An open road with an open gate

tracks.title: Dreams Of Destruction
tracks.lyrics:
Dreams of destruction, born from your pain,
Every tear a lesson, every scar a name.
Dreams of destruction, I rise from the fall,
Thank you for giving me the nerve to take it all.

You forced me to change,
To die and rise anew.
If not for your cruelty,
I’d be just like you.

Your disrespect, the weight of your scorn,
Became the fire where I was reborn.

Dreams of destruction, born from your pain,
Every tear a lesson, every scar a name.
Dreams of destruction, I rise from the fall,
Thank you for giving me the nerve to take it all.

If you hadn’t spit on me,
If you hadn’t pushed me down,
I’d have never found the courage,
To stand my ground.

I wouldn’t have martyred myself for this art,
Wouldn’t have fought through the dark.

Dreams of destruction, born from your pain,
Every tear a lesson, every scar a name.
Dreams of destruction, I rise from the fall,
Thank you for giving me the nerve to take it all.

Thank you, thank you, for making me cry.
Thank you, thank you, for giving me the will to try.

tracks.title: The Insects Have Finally Taken Over
tracks.lyrics:
I knew this day would come, saw it creeping near
All that was inside me is empty, bare, and clear
My universe is theirs now, taken bit by bit
Tiny creatures, endless names, feeding in the pit

Rage, hope, nothing, care –
Sell, cell, cry, despair!
Swarming over me
They’ve claimed the air I breathe

Words crawl from my mouth, they leave me numb and raw
They eat at my feelings, bite by vicious bite, they gnaw
Language is a parasite, crawling through my veins
Leaving nothing but echoes, empty space remains

Rage, hope, nothing, care –
Sell, cell, cry, despair!
Swarming over me
They’ve claimed the air I breathe

Crave the poison, make love to the pain
Stop reading, stop writing, let the bugs reign
My soul’s dissolved, my will is thin
The insects have finally taken me in

They whisper “FUCK, SHIT, DIE” from underneath my skin
Each word another dose of toxin sinking in
Vomit, spit, and numbness, swirling in their hive
I’m the hollow carcass that they’ve left behind alive

Rage, hope, nothing, care –
Sell, cell, cry, despair!
Swarming over me
They’ve claimed the air I breathe

Outside is a beautiful day, but I’m caged in here
Surrounded by the buzzing, every shadow reappears
The insects have taken over, their whispers fill your head
So close your eyes, surrender – You're better off dead

Rage, hope, nothing, care –
Sell, cell, cry, despair!
Swarming over me
They’ve claimed the air I breathe

tracks.title: Move Like Water
tracks.lyrics:
I learned to breathe beneath the surface,
In the dark where pressure fades.
She taught me peace in the undertow,
Where nothing breaks, just bends and flows.

Capsized by the wave, but I float inside,
No struggle now, just the ride.
Drift with the current, lose control,
The deep calls out to me, and I answer slow
I see the shoreline out in the distance,
But I’m here to stay, brother, no resistance.
caught in the sway, I move with ease,
Let the water carry me where it pleases.

Move like water, flow where I’m called,
Bend with the river, no fight at all.
When the currents rise, I won’t fall,
I’ll move like water, through it all.

I tried to swim against the waterfall,
Only to be dragged beneath it all.
The fall was steep, the current wide,
But I float now, with the changing tide.
What I thought was strength, I let it break,
Found my power when I let it take.
No fight, just flow, but now I see,
With the force of nature , I part the sea.

Move like water, flow where I’m called, 
Bend with the river, no fight at all.
When the currents rise, I won’t fall,
I’ll move like water, through it all.

A ripple spreads from the smallest stone,
Disturbs the calm, but I’m not alone.
The water shifts, but I let it go,
We’re all just waves in the same flow.

tracks.title: Indescribable
tracks.lyrics:
It starts as a whisper, soft and thin,
A thought too sharp to stay within.
The walls close in, the mirrors crack,
Every shadow creeping to pull me back.

And I’m just watching, frozen in place,
The slow-motion collapse of the human race.

Indescribable, it’s falling apart,
Pieces of a soul, shards of a heart.
Indescribable, spinning out of control,
Breaking the body, it's all gone cold.

A spark ignites in the hollow frame,
The fire spreads, but it has no name.
A house of glass, dying inside,
Shattering silence with nowhere to hide.

No way to stop it, no way to rewind,
It all falls to pieces in the back of your mind.

Indescribable, it’s falling apart,
Pieces of a soul, shards of a heart.
Indescribable, spinning out of control,
Breaking the body, it's all gone cold.

I tried to hold it together, I swear I did.
But the floor gave way, and I can’t forgive.
Each thought’s a wave, dragging me down,
And no one can save me, I’m going to drown.

Indescribable, it’s falling apart,
Pieces of a soul, shards of a heart.
Indescribable, spinning out of control,
Breaking the body, it's all gone cold.

Indescribable…

tracks.title: Unmade Bed
tracks.lyrics:
The violence in my heart, the silence I keep,
The love I don’t let in, the secrets buried deep.
The dishes in the sink, the unmade bed,
These quiet symbols of the words unsaid.
Outside, the world tears itself apart,
But I retreat to a house of art.
Curtains drawn, shadows fall,
A clean facade while the cracks crawl the walls.

The unmade bed waits just beyond,
Where the wind howls loud, where the order’s gone.
Your tidy walls can’t hold the weight,
Of a world undone, of a fractured state.

Bad thoughts I can’t escape, visions I can’t shake,
A house in order can’t stop what breaks.
This quiet chaos, a fragile frame,
The weight of guilt when we share the blame.
The streets cry out, the lights grow dim,
A fractured state that can’t hold in.
But here I sit, my hands are tied,
While you stand tall on the system’s side.

The unmade bed waits just beyond,
Where the wind howls loud, where the order’s gone.
Your tidy walls can’t hold the weight,
Of a world undone, of a fractured state.

You speak of order from on high,
While the rest of us can only try.
Your tidy world, a great diversion,
From the system’s deepest perversion.

The unmade bed, it stays the same,
A witness left to take the blame.
And though you try, you can’t ignore,
The storm outside, it rattles the door.
